comment: I will never take this professor again. She never gave any feedback or grades until the last day of class. We never knew what our grades were and she got mad if we asked!

Under no circumstances should you take this teacher. She was rude, impolite, commonly made assignments even harder for students to understand, didn't answer emails, did not send grades to students until the month before the class ended, and is likely doing this for the money which was a common consensus between students. Never take this teacher.

I really like Prof Mosholder. She is harsh at times but has given me some very useful and meaningful assistance that has changed my whole perspective of art. She exposed us to a lot of different real world artists. Would totally take her again, it's worth it. Do your work and treat the class seriously and you'll be good!
Great Professor! This was my first art class ever and I passed with an A. Expect to put a lot of time in outside of class. Follow instructions, ask questions and youll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: An impressive class. You must put effort into every piece you create, and she will push you to do so. Every project assigned is to test your ability as an artist. You CANNOT turn in a project you did in one day or put no thought behind. She is here to teach you to be an artist with intention, and if you push yourself you will do well.

Professor Mosholder is one of the best professors. Her projects are a lot of fun and not only help improve your skills as an artist, but allows for you to share your creativity as well. Shes very open to helping her students and pushes them to be the best they can. Shes also a really cool person and an amazing artist. Shes the best! Take her!

I don't know why so many reviews say she is great at communication! She isn't. I've emailed, messaged, and used groupme but yet she ignored it. She did this to everyone. I never got my grades until the very end. TAKE SOMEONE ELSE!

She was the worst professor. If you want to learn 3D, take someone else! She a tough grader but you'll never see your grades until the end. She doesn't give advice or good suggestions. This is suppose to be a beginner class but she makes it super difficult.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Very tough grader and incredibly high expectations, despite being an intro class. Class was clearly not a priority for her, our time was treated like a joke. Scheduled field trips on non class days, then didn't even show up. I never got to see my grade on any of my assignments, only my final grade for the semester at the VERY end.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I recommend never taking her. I thought it would be cool having an artist as a professor but thus job is clearly just for extra money. She was my worst professor experience. She is a tough grader if you even see your grade before the end of the semester. I know several classmates who never got grades until the final grades were due. She is mean!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I already made a review but Idfc. HW is always in the assignments tab check it regularly. During my time she had a groupme, @ her or dm her with questions or ask your grade. She has projects where you can do whatever you want for them, but if you need instruction or help with an idea ask and you shall receive. It's amazing how communication works.

This ain't a highschool art class ight? You have to actually put effort in. Mosholder can smell your bullshiet from a mile away. If you do put in the effort, she'll know and will grade you accordingly. I had her for ART 2990 too and made a B which was my first B in an art class. Yet I took her again because I love that she pushed me to be better.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: No idea if this was an off-semester from her, but this class taught by Prof Mosholder was the worst college expereience I've ever had. Lectures are nonexistent, expectations are far too high for the class level, and just forget it if you need to get in contact with her. She ignores emails, meetings, and messages and treats your time like a joke.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Professor Mosholder has been an amazing professor during this pandemic. One of my top two teachers I've ever had. She is incredibly understanding and will work with you if you can't come to class or have any sort of complication. She gives good, constructive feedback on assignments and is just an all-around considerate, caring person.

Megan Mosholder is one of my favorite professors so far. I took her for 3D design in fall 2020 during this crazy pandemic. This was a struggle, but she helped us use our minds to really get creative with materials at home. Shes truly an amazing individual, and she inspires me to keep pushing as artist. A mentor and a professor in one amazing woman

I absolutely love professor Mosholder, do not trust that bad review LOL She is the sweetest and most understanding professor I have ever had. She makes it her goal to work with you and wants you to embrace your creativity in her class! Assignments strive to keep you thinking outside the box and push you out of your comfort zone! TAKE HER!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Assignments are randomly uploaded with no announcement, so we are not alerted of them. You have to dig for due dates and additional assignments. I have missed or almost missed assignments because there is zero organization. A couple months into class, I have received no grades or feedback. There is zero instruction, it's like we are on our own.

She is a fantastic art professor and truly care about her students and class. Sometimes her homework assignments can be vague but she allows her class to give her constructive criticism on what to fix for her next classes. Very funny and sweet.

Chill teacher. Mostly focuses on abstract art, I got a new assignment every week, which got tiring but it wasn't too bad. The assignments weren't terribly boring. Doesn't answer email much though. Overall good proffessor
